data.enText: a place where people can exchange opinions and ideas on a particular issue; a meeting organized for this purpose
data.chText: 公共讨论场所；论坛；讨论会

data.enText: Television is now an important forum for political debate.
data.chText: 电视已成了政治辩论的重要擂台。

data.enText: to hold an international forum on drug abuse
data.chText: 举行药物滥用问题国际论坛

data.enText: (in ancient Rome) a public place where meetings were held

simple_means.memory_skill: for- 门外,外边,外部的 + -um 场所,地点

tr: a public facility to meet for open discussion
a public meeting or assembly for open discussion

example.ex: Members of the council agreed that it still had an important role as a forum for discussion...
example.tran: 理事会成员一致认为它仍然发挥着论坛的重要作用。

example.ex: The organisation would provide a forum where problems could be discussed.
example.tran: 这个组织将提供一个可以讨论问题的平台。

value.def: A forum is a place, situation, or group in which people exchange ideas and discuss issues, especially important public issues.
value.tran: (尤指讨论重大公共问题的)论坛，会议场所，讨论会

value.def: In ancient Roman towns, the forum was a square where people met to discuss business and political matters.
value.tran: (古罗马城镇中讨论商业和政治问题的)广场

trans: 世界经济论坛；世界经济
开放论坛；公开论坛；开放式论坛；空中论坛
学术论坛；学术讲座；学术园地
东盟地区论坛；东协区域论坛；东盟区域论坛

partsOfSpeech.dec: for- 门外,外边,外部的 + eign
for- 门外,外边,外部的 + est 存在
mus- 娱乐 + -um 场所,地点
